Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType>
class stGenericPriorityHeap< ObjectType >

This class implements a global priority queue based on a heap used for the Incremental Nearest Neighbor.

This priority queue is implemented using a dynamic heap. This implementation of priority queue is based on the paper "Incremental Similarity Search in Multimedia Databases" - G. R. Hjaltason & Hanan Samet - 2000.

Author:
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)
Version:
1.0
Todo:
review the documentation.
See also:
stDynamicRPriorityQueue

Member Enumeration Documentation

template<class ObjectType>
enum stGenericPriorityHeap::tType
 

This type is used to store the type of the entry.

This is done because the caracteristics of the Incremental algorithm.

Enumeration values:
OBJECT  The entry is a object.
APPROXIMATEOBJECT  The entry is a approximate object.
NODE  The entry is a node.
APPROXIMATENODE  The entry is a approximate node.

Definition at line 477 of file stGenericPriorityQueue.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class ObjectType>
stGenericPriorityHeap< ObjectType >::stGenericPriorityHeap (  int  initialSize,
int  increment = 32
)  [inline]
 

Creates a new reverse priority queue. The initialSize is used to reserve a certain number of entries in this queue while increment is the number of entries to add to the capacity when the addition of a new entry overflows the current capacity (resize).

To increase the performance of this class it is necessary set the paramenters initialSize and increment to optimal values which can be chosen according to the nature of the problem.

Usually large values for initialSize and increment tend to enhance the performance in exchange of memory usage and small values will optimize the memory usage in exchange of performance.

Parameters:
initialSize Initial capacity of this queue.
increment The number of entries to add to the capacity when required.
Note:
If the value of initialSize is optimal (a number greater or equal to the real maximum size of the queue, the performance of this implementation will be almost as fast as stRPriorityQueue.

Member Function Documentation

template<class ObjectType>
void stGenericPriorityHeap< ObjectType >::Add (  tObject *  object,
stPageID  pageID,
stDistance  distanceQuery,
stDistance  distanceRep,
stDistance  distanceRepQuery,
stDistance  radius,
stCount  height,
tType  type
) 
 

Adds a new entry to the queue. This method will fail if the number of objects exceeds the maximum number of positions.

Parameters:
object The object to be inserted.
pageID The pageID to be inserted.
distanceQuery The distance from this entry and the query object.
distanceRep The distance from the object and the representative.
distanceRepQuery The distance from the representative and the query object.
radius The radius value of the subtree to be inserted.
height The height of this entry to be inserted.
type The type of this entry.

template<class ObjectType>
bool stGenericPriorityHeap< ObjectType >::Get (  tObject *&  object,
stPageID &  pageID,
stDistance &  distanceQuery,
stDistance &  distanceRep,
stDistance &  distanceRepQuery,
stDistance &  radius,
stCount &  height,
tType &  type
) 
 

Gets the next entry with the minimum key value. This entry is removed from the queue.

Parameters:
object The object to be inserted.
pageID The pageID to be inserted.
distanceQuery The distance from this entry and the query object.
distanceRep The distance from the object and the representative.
distanceRepQuery The distance from the representative and the query object.
radius The radius value of the subtree to be inserted.
height The height of this entry.
type The type of this entry.
Returns:
True for success or false it the queue is empty.
